meanings.definition: To make greater in power, influence, or reputation.
meanings.sent1: She aggrandized her role in the school play by taking on extra responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The mayor aggrandized his authority by implementing new policies.
meanings.sent3: The cat aggrandized its hunting skills by catching a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His success aggrandized him to the status of a local hero.
meanings.sent5: The artist aggrandized the size of the mountain in her painting to make it more impressive.

meanings.sent1: He aggrandized his fishing story by claiming the fish was twice its actual size.
meanings.sent2: The author aggrandized the historical events in her novel to make them more exciting.
meanings.sent3: The child aggrandized the size of the ice cream cone he had by describing it as a tower.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination aggrandized the simple garden into a magical wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The politician aggrandized his opponent's faults to gain more support from the voters.
